intro: Euphrasia suecica, commonly known as the Swedish eyebright, is a flowering plant native to northern Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are square and branched. Euphrasia suecica is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
